appeng.api.movable

Interface IMovableHandler


  • public interface IMovableHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canHandle(java.lang.Class<? extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity> myClass, net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity tile)
      if you return true from this, your saying you can handle the class, not that single entity, you cannot opt out of single entities.
      void moveTile(net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity tile, net.minecraft.world.World world, net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos newPosition)
      request that the handler move the the tile from its current location to the new one.

    • Method Detail

      • canHandle

        boolean canHandle(java.lang.Class<? extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity> myClass,
                  net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity tile)
        if you return true from this, your saying you can handle the class, not that single entity, you cannot opt out of single entities.
        Parameters:
        myClass - tile entity class
        tile - tile entity
        Returns:
        true if it can handle moving

      • moveTile

        void moveTile(net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity tile,
              net.minecraft.world.World world,
              net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos newPosition)
        request that the handler move the the tile from its current location to the new one. the tile has already been invalidated, and the blocks have already been fully moved. Potential Example: 
         {
        @code
        Chunk c = world.getChunkFromBlockCoords( x, z );
        c.setChunkBlockTileEntity( x & 0xF, y + y, z & 0xF, tile );

        if( c.isChunkLoaded )
        {
                world.addTileEntity( tile );
                world.markBlockForUpdate( x, y, z );
        }
 }
        Parameters:
        tile - to be moved tile
        world - world of tile
        newPosition - the new location
